comment.author: 16489083@N05
comment._content: Sailing somewhere for sure... great portrait in B&W!!! Must have been when she was commissioned to decorate the second floor of the newly built home in New York City for Henry Clay Frick in 1915. See: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lady_Mendl
comment.authorname: maorlando God kept us 2012 leaning on Him 2013

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Though the picture is dated 1920, it is likely that it and the next 7 pictures were taken on December 6, 1915 when Ms. DeWolfe returned to New York from Bordeaux, France aboard the French ocean liner Lafayette. She and most of the people in the photos are named in a contemporary account of the ship's arrival.: select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F3091FF6385B1773...
